name: Sporty Grandma vs. Realistic Zombie Cops (Just Follow the Breif Edition)
name_original: Sporty Grandma vs. Realistic Zombie Cops (Just Follow the Breif Edition)
description:
THIS IS VERY MUCH A WORK IN PROGRESS, I MADE THIS PAGE FOR AN ASSIGNMENT, THE GAME ITSELF IS FAR FROM COMPLETE

Welcome to Abstractland! Where
nothing makes sense and styles
clash more than your grandson’s
suit color and tie! You are Sporty
Grandma and you need to make it to the end
of each stage while
fighting off a horde of
Realistic Zombie Cops!
Gameplay
Sporty Grandma Vs. Realistic Zombie Cops is a third person action game starring “Sporty Grandma” while
she fights off a horde of Realistic Zombie Police in various stages armed with a sword, a few grenades,
and a gun. Limited ammunition is given each stage and players are graded on stage completion time, and
the number of kills they got in the stage. Bonus points will be given out if several enemies are dispatched
in quick succession. The stages are set in Abstractland, where nothing makes sense and everything is
strange, especially the clashing of styles between the character models, thus the player never knows
what to expect in the next stage! Before each stage, the player has the option to change out swords, guns
and grenades to help them do better in the stage depending on what they have unlocked.
Story and Visuals
The story is simple, you are sporty grandma, and suddenly you were transported to Abstractland! There’s
a bunch of Realistic Zombie Cops and grandma conveniently is well trained in sword and gunplay!
The game is set is a place called Abstractland. The visuals will be heavily
inspired by the kind of art that people tend to make with raytracing software
such as Bryce 3D it will be bright, colorful and
strange. Some levels may be themed in ways com-
pletely dissonant from others, this is something
heavily inspired by the indie game “Puss!”. Levels
may have a unique mechanic and the visual lan-
guage will complement that. This decision is made
because the character models chosen for the game are so dissonant and differ-
ent that it would only make sense in this context.
